channel.title: [Delta] 317 - How to change the standard in game crowns?
channel.description: There are no mod icons anywhere in the client folder, and i've tried multiple delta clients with the same scenario. I've also looked this up before, and it seems like there is a certain amount of coding you have to do to replace them. Suggestions?

item.title: [Delta] 317 - How to change the standard in game crowns?
item.dc:creator: @Mikeyzzz Mikeyzzz
item.description:
@Mikeyzzz wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:545400”][quote author=Beemobmo71 link=topic=664284.msg4440602#msg4440602 date=1406510253]
Thank you so much. As you can probably tell, i’m very new to coding.
[/quote]
Everyone starts from somewhere. Read some java docs and java tutorials. Don’t just base it all on RSPS, because java is huge and actually a good language. You can apply what you learn for more things than just a RSPS.
I make random tools all the time with it ^.^[/quote] A random tool appeared.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] 317 - How to change the standard in game crowns?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Beemobmo71:

There are no mod icons anywhere in the client folder, and i’ve tried multiple delta clients with the same scenario. I’ve also looked this up before, and it seems like there is a certain amount of coding you have to do to replace them. Suggestions?

They are cache packed.
Get tom’s cache editor, and open your cache in it.

From there, follow this diagram:

Edit:
The diagram is for Adding new ones. If you simply want to replace the current ones. Click on either 0 or 1, then hit replace.
Don’t use transparent images. Use one with a pink background (RGB: 255, 0, 255. Hex: #FF00FF ). The pink is read as transparent.

Read full topic
item.source: [Delta] 317 - How to change the standard in game crowns?
